thread.title: With Sully’s opening, it’s a zoo on Castle Island today
thread.title_full: With Sully’s opening, it’s a zoo on Castle Island today - The Boston Globe

title: With Sully’s opening, it’s a zoo on Castle Island today
text:
David L Ryan/Globe Staff
It was just under an hour wait for a hot dog at Sullivan’s.
By Heather Ciras Globe Staff February 23, 2017
There are a few reliable signs that spring is near in Boston: Red Sox pitchers and catchers, daffodils starting to peek through the dirt in the Public Garden, and Sullivan’s — the concession stand at Castle Island in South Boston — opening for the season.
Well, that last one came early this year, as Sully’s opened on Thursday. The shop was supposed to open Saturday, but with the good weather, opened two days early. And good news, there will be half-priced hot dogs until March 3.
WE ARE OPENING TOMORROW THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 23rd @ 8:30AM! Hot Dogs are Half priced! #SpringIsOfficiallyHere #HotDogsBurgersandFriesOhMY pic.twitter.com/VToXT29BhS
— Sullivan's (@sullydogs) February 22, 2017 Advertisement
Looks like Fitzy from Southie was the first customer in line, ordering at least a soda by 11 a.m.
screenshot via twitter
David L Ryan/Globe Staff
Hayden Shores, 5, got a nice big bite of a hot dog.
After Fitzy came and went, the line got significantly longer: Some people remarked that they snuck out to get a bite on their lunch break, others said they were bringing the kids because it is February vacation.
People posted their experiences to social media:
Looks like they're giving money away at Sullivan's on Castle Island. Line stretches back more than a football field. pic.twitter.com/WVvS4iYSkt
— Kevin Cullen (@GlobeCullen) February 23, 2017 >
#Spring is here in South Boston. Line around the corner for Sully's at Castle Island! #Southie #castleisland @sullydogs @MassDCR pic.twitter.com/zRKr4DsTxi
— Nick Collins (@repnickcollins) February 23, 2017
Lining up to savor the last moments of summer at Castle Island #Sullys pic.twitter.com/rBuApt6fvX
— Stefan Economou (@oysterbrine) October 7, 2016 Apparently everyone else on the South Shore also thought it was a good idea to leave work to go to Castle Island/Sullys
— jill (@jillianmco) February 23, 2017 Just a little bit of a line to get to sullys pic.twitter.com/qcwmEJdxQR
— Owen Anastas (@MAweatherHQ) February 23, 2017
View Gallery Balmy temps hit Boston area
Children’s Winter Festival was a sunny, balmy affair
Even the pups showed up for a bite to eat:
David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
Piper the dog got tired and waited in a baby carriage.
Some had some fun with the ridiculousness of waiting in line for an hour for a hot dog:
#Boston #bospoli #mapoli #sullivans #sullydog #sullivans #castleisland #BostonStrong @KevinCullen67 @BostonGlobe @Linda_Pizzuti #RedSox pic.twitter.com/AvmffqC6pq
— Thomas Sullivan (@TomSullBoston) February 23, 2017

Heather Ciras can be reached at heather.ciras@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @heatherciras .
